wiki.content:
"Smile" is a song, originally used as an instrumental theme in the soundtrack for the 1936 Charlie Chaplin movie Modern Times. Chaplin composed the music. While some believe the words were written by John Turner and Geoffrey Parsons.  Recorded in 1954 by Nat King Cole.  (Wikipedia)
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Smile" is a song, originally used as an instrumental theme in the soundtrack for the 1936 Charlie Chaplin movie Modern Times. Chaplin composed the music. While some believe the words were written by John Turner and Geoffrey Parsons.  Recorded in 1954 by Nat King Cole.  (Wikipedia)

name: Smile
comments: took long enough for this song to come on. love you, nat.
ONE OF THE GREATEST VOICES IN THE HISTORY OF POPULAR MUSIC THE ONE AND ONLY NAT KING COLE
Great song, great singer,hope they're right.
Gotta smile....What else can ya do?
so beautiful, love last fm for having this on my recommended radio :)
You just have to smile.just a wonderful song
Perhaps the song which completely epitomized Charlie Chaplin's life...
One of the most uplifting songs ever. Nat was "The One" To record this. The song was from 1954.

Nat Cole is the greatest male singer of the 20th century. At once mellow and swinging, his voice was so soothing and definitive. That racism entered the picture will always be another scar on America.
